Text: Graawwgghh!!!
Hyaaahh!!! Swish, swish, swish, swish, swiiiishhhh!!!
Ooh... Nice upswing!
I-I hit it! I'm in great shape today!
All right, I've just gotta keep this upâ€”
Wait, it's not doing any damage?!

I'm clearly penetrating its skin, unlike with the
Mist Dragon! And, I'm supposed to be stronger
than back then!
Graaaawwwl!!!
Eeeep?!

I-It's strong...fast...and tough! Despite having such
a dumb-looking face, it is a dragon, after all!

Gamma is afraid of falling...so she doesn't try
dodging the attacks too much. That's why she's
so useful for investigations like this... Heheh...
Now fight... Fight more!
Huff...huff...huff!
Hmm... This is a slugfest.

Even with all my "swish" attacks...why doesn't it
feel like...I'm making any progress?!

Because Malak's wounds are healing...
at super speed.
Huh?

I observed it during your first attack. And...after
multiple observations, my hypothesis turned into
certainty.

When you'd "swish, swish, swish"....between each
swish, it would already finish regenerating.

That's why it doesn't appear wounded...because it
actually isn't.
But!

...B-But if that's the case, then I'll go all out
with a single-hit kill!

That might be one way to do it...if you could
actually land a decisive blow like that,
Gamma...but, knowing you...

Eta! That's a terrible thing to say! Apologize to me
immediately!
...I'm sorry. Forgive me.
What an insincere apology!

But...it wasn't Master Shadow's teachings that were
wrong. It's just that I'm inexperienced, and the foe
is formidable...
Grrraaaaahhh!
Whoa!
Hang in there...Gamma...

Huff...huff...! I'm completely exhausted... I want to
rest a bit and then start again!
Oh...I forgot to mention...
There's something else?!

Even if you manage to land a single-hit kill...
if this Malak happens to be a real dragon...

Just like with the Mist Dragon, it may be impossible
to kill unless done so in a specific way... Maybe.
...Whaaaat?!

I'm such an idiot! I completely forgot about
that!

Gamma, you were dazzled by the title of Dragon
Slayer... Heheheh... Thanks to that, I was able to
observe you meticulously.

Ngh... That's it! Abort your observations! Abort!
There's no point persisting against an unbeatable
opponent!

Since we can't move this dragon from here,
frustrating as it is...we should fall back for nowâ€”
If it won't move, we'll just have to make it...
You've made the slime mimic my appearance?
...*scoot*

There's no way it'll fall for such an obvious bait
when I'm standing right in frontâ€”
Graaaaaawl!!!
Huhhh...?! It seriously fell for it?!

It's disappointingly unintelligent for a dragon...
But...heheh...it makes for a worthy test subject.

I can study the dragon's ecology alongside our
investigation for oil...
Madlid... This place is...fun!

Right now, I bet you're the only one in the world who
genuinely thinks that, Eta.

Shall we start digging for oil, then? Although,
if this is Malak's territory...it might be back
once the slime's effects wear off...

In that case, let's get out of here for now. Even if
we're digging for oil, there should be other
locations also worth considering!
Ah... So this is it!

Yes, my lord! This is our base, Alexandria,
the Shadow Garden's headquarters!
Alexandria!

(...I see. They've developed a self-sufficient place
by re-purposing the ruins of a city that perished
long ago.)

(Even after the possessed are cured, it's a challenge
to reintegrate into society in this chaotic world.)

(Considering the state of this world, it seems like a
viable option...to live modestly in a vast hidden
village like this.)

(With the forest filled with poison mist and the
presence of a dragon, it seems unlikely anyone
would attack.)
Heh... I see.
My lord!
This is the training center!

The members of the Garden train in these facilities
day and night!

Quit slacking off! You've got one set left! Give it
your all!
Training!

(...This place is obviously just another of Eta's
grand pranks.)

(Structurally speaking, it feels more like a dueling
arena that enforces survival battles than a training
center.)

(Well...Eta's handiwork aside, that girl there
gives off a real drill sergeant vibe!)
Lambda!
Yes!

It's your first time meeting him, isn't it? This here
is our lord, Master Shadow.
Sir! Yes sir!
Whoa...
I am Lambda, responsible for the members' training!

I express my deepest gratitude for the chance to meet
you, Master Shadow, and for your hand in saving my
life through your leadership.

I will continue to devote myself wholeheartedly to
the Shadow Garden!
...Very well.
(Wow. She's quite the actor!)

(She's a stoic female officer with a militaristic
aura, training and honing the members of a
secret organization... What a beautiful collection
of clichÃ© archetypes.)

(And, for some reason unclear to the casual observer,
she always has one eye shut. It's an otherworldly
behavior that scores her extra points!)

(It's no exaggeration to say that this type of person
radiates with a subtle brilliance when it comes to
shadowbroker play.)

(That said, the girl may be a former possessed as
well, but I'm surprised Alpha managed to find such
an over-the-top talent!)

(...Anyway, I need to respond appropriatelyâ€”
All right!)

Heh... So, you include magic adaptability within your
strict training. Insightful.
Keep up the good work.
...Sir! Yes sir!
Hmm...

(I don't think I've ever seen this type of salute in
this world... Now it's time for my shadowbroker
move!)
Heh... There!
*gasp* N-No way!

Impossible... A hidden passageway?! I can't believe
such a mechanism existed! It wasn't on the blueprint!
It's obvious by reading the flow of magic and air.

In fact, it's highly unnatural for there to be an
area where the flow is completely blocked.

I seriously can't believe Eta would go so far as to
hide something like this!

...Fledglings! We're changing our training program!
From now on, we'll search for hidden passages in
the training center! This is not a drill! I repeat, this
is not a drill!

(I had a hunch something was around here, poked
around, and was right on the money... It's a typical
concealment tactic by the ever-experimental Eta.)

(Well, it beats causing a scene and drawing attention
in a crowded place. In that sense, this ancient city
may be an ideal location.)
Epsilon. Please continue the tour.
U-Understood! Let's head to the castleâ€”
We'll meet again, Lambda.
Yes!

...He subtly encouraged me where I lacked confidence
in my hypothesis that prior "rehabilitation" may be
important in combat training for the possessed...

...and the significance of acclimatizing their bodies
to their newly acquired magical power.

Like a gently comforting shadow on a quiet night.
That individual is our leader...Master Shadow!

...Right, I will officially submit the proposal for
improvements to Lady Alpha to incorporate a
rehabilitation period before the training program!

...And in this way, we're restoring the ancient
city's architecture and utilizing it as our base.
I see...

(It's got a slightly old-fashioned vibe, being an
ancient city and all, but, put another way, it's
filled with a sense of old-world charm.)

(Not the typical villa for royals or aristocrats. It
allows you to feel the full weight of history...and
the accumulation of things.)

(In other words, it's been adorned with years of
dedication. Along with the remote location, it's
the perfect base for shadowbrokers.)
However!
My lord?
This "base" is lacking something.
*gasp* Lacking something?
(Something essential is missing here.)
(Yes... Strategic location!)
Um, my lord!

(If I were living at the Midgard Academy for Dark
Knights' dorms, it would be much easier to come
here...)

(But considering my current position, even if I dash
here at full speed from the Kagenou mansion to play
shadowbroker, I'd have to return immediately...
It's not realistic.)
My lord! What is this base lacking?!

(This place is ultimately a secure haven for the
possessed, which Alpha and the others stumbled
upon during their girls' picnic outing.)

(And I'm glad everyone has designated it as our
"base" and indulged me in my hobby.)

(That's why even if I were to point out the strategic
disadvantages of this location, it wouldn't result in
anything substantial and would only disappoint
everyone who's been considerate of me.)

(So I'll take my time. I'll subtly make them aware
that this setting is difficult for me "currently.")

Don't worry... It's not that this place itself is
lacking anything.

That is to say, if it had this "thing," it would be
better for it. It's simply somewhat lacking
conceptually.
My lord!

Ah, I should be heading back. It'll raise suspicions
if I don't show up from morning till evening.

Thanks for showing me around today, Epsilon.
I'll come again.

R-Right! The pleasure is all mine, my lord! I will
see you off to the Abyss Woods.
...Something conceptually lacking from this place!

Surely our lord is testing us to see if we can
properly grasp his thinking and make up for
what Alexandria lacks!

In any case, I'll have to discuss it with everyone in
the Seven Shadows!
